An Image of a glass vial, used to store the found gold
A glass vial, used to store the found gold
Knife sized digging tool, useful to penetrate the Earth\'s soil
Miner\'s pan, used to pan small amounts of gold from the soil

Discovered in 1827 by Benjamin Haile, The Haile Gold Mine was one of the first – and most profitable – operating gold mines in the U.S. The Haile Operation is located 3 miles northeast of the town of Kershaw in Lancaster County, South Carolina. Haile’s mining operations includes approximately 4,552 acres of land that over nearly two centuries has had multiple waves of mining activity.
Image of a small scale sluice box often placed inside rivers and stream
